page.title: 05Bouley Bay Hill Climb
page.content: This is one of the events organised by the Jersey Motor Cycle and Light Car Club. The road from Bouley Bay up is a very steep and winding hill ideal for the race called a "hill climb" which is very popular throughout Britain. There are separate classes for motor bikes and cars. The race is a time trial against the clock from the bottom to the top of the 1O11 yard long course. There are three meetings a year. There is one on Easter Monday and on the Spring Bank Holiday. These are called closed events because they are only for local competitors. The main event is during the third weekend in July . It is one of the{British {National Hill Climb championships}and so is an open event . In June l985 the fastest car record was 39 seconds,held by {Martin Bolsover. This gives an {average speed of 51.5 m.p.h.}
